dpul.title: Batch Ingested Princeton-Only MVW Scanned Resources are syncing to DPUL as extracted individual volumes
Treasures of the East Asian Library Reindex issues

comments.body: Just an update on this issue:  I have gradually been adding items to this collection, and some appear in DPUL right away, others not even after several days.  As of today, I have marked reels 1-136 as complete in Figgy, and 20 of them are missing in DPUL: 100, 102-106, 108, 110-112, 117, 118, 120, 121, 124, 125, 128, 130, 132, and 134.  To me, there is no obvious pattern to which reels appear in DPUL and which do not.

pdc_describe.title: Ensuring that ApprovedFileMoveJob errors are handled for cases in which the ApprovedUploadSnapshot cannot be resolved
Moving work validation to a Service before we make it more complex
Work on staging with 62,484 files is only displaying 54,568 in the UploadSnapshot

comments.body: @carolyncole I wonder if we should set a limit (say 10,000 files). For any work that has more than 10K files we display a warning on the client saying there are more than 10,000 files. Not ideal but better than crashing the page or not loading at all. Maybe we could even indicate the total number of files, just not display them.
I would suggest we background the snapshot update and just display the last one.  And additionally do some work to make the code more efficient.  And create another ticket about what to do on the UI

pdc_discovery.title: Make it more clear what rake task we're running regularly
made Re-index rake task more clear
Error Indexing cron: [pdc_discovery/staging] Net::ReadTimeout: Net::ReadTimeout with #<Socket:(closed)>

comments.body:
Still breaking as of Thursday November 30. :( 

What we've tried:
* Restarting it (makes it work for awhile, then it breaks again within a day or two)
* Moving all the solr staging nodes to the same network
* Move all the zookeeper nodes to the same network (note that it is hard to tell whether the zookeeper nodes are the right ones, so it might be worth double checking whether this has really been tried)
* Reading the zookeeper logs to look for clues (didn't find anything that seemed meaningful) 



![Screenshot 2023-11-30 at 8 18 07â€¯AM](https://github.com/pulibrary/pdc_discovery/assets/65608/b215390a-b424-4c54-9ca6-d99c04deaa10)

Regarding the "which zookeepers" question - yesterday we moved several zookeeper machines, based on the config we found on the Solr8 boxes. Here's a list of the machines that are currently all in the same datacenter and should not encounter latency issues communicating with each other - I believe these are the correct ones (in other words, these three zookeeper boxes are connecting to these three solr boxes):

- lib-solr-staging4
- lib-solr-staging5
- lib-solr-staging6
- lib-zk-staging1
- lib-zk-staging2
- lib-zk-staging3

I noticed that our reindex task seems to hang while fetching the data from DataSpace...the job never finishes and then the schedule reindex kicks off 1/2 hour later and that's the error that we are seeing in Honeybadger, but the real problem was that the previous reindex did not complete. It looks to me like Solr is (understandably) blocking the second reindex. 

```
deploy@pdc-discovery-staging1:/opt/pdc_discovery/current$ grep "Indexing" log/staging.log
I, [2023-11-30T00:00:36.057221 #738840]  INFO -- : Indexing: Created a new collection for writing: http://lib-solr8-staging.princeton.edu:8983/solr/pdc-discovery-staging-1
I, [2023-11-30T00:00:36.057376 #738840]  INFO -- : Indexing: Fetching PDC Describe records
I, [2023-11-30T00:00:36.057775 #738840]  INFO -- : Indexing: Harvesting and indexing PDC Describe data started
I, [2023-11-30T00:06:59.830116 #738840]  INFO -- : Indexing: Harvesting and indexing PDC Describe data completed
I, [2023-11-30T00:06:59.830258 #738840]  INFO -- : Indexing: Fetching DataSpace records
I, [2023-11-30T00:06:59.830488 #738840]  INFO -- : Indexing: Harvesting and indexing DataSpace research data collections started

Notice that the DataSpace reindex started at 00:06:59 never finished.
A complete reindex will also log:

Indexing: Harvesting and indexing DataSpace research data collections completed
Indexing: Fetching completed
Indexing: Updated Solr to read from the new collection: pdc-discovery-staging/ -> ...

and then the reindex kicked in at 00:30:03 but I guess since the previous one has not finished Solr is 
blocking our second reindex.

I, [2023-11-30T00:30:03.209589 #745144]  INFO -- : Indexing: Research Data indexing started
I, [2023-11-30T01:00:03.163854 #751255]  INFO -- : Indexing: Research Data indexing started
I, [2023-11-30T01:30:03.117385 #757441]  INFO -- : Indexing: Research Data indexing started
...
```

I've deployed a version of Discovery (PR https://github.com/pulibrary/pdc_discovery/pull/538) that does not fetch DataSpace data to see if our reindex runs without issues for 24 hours or more.

comments.body:
in the nfsserver dependencies for meta, wondering if we can call the deploy user role twice, once with defaults and once with different username. Something like this:
```yaml
dependencies:
  - role: deploy_user
    vars:
        deploy_user: conan
```
Probably need to override other default variables also but I'm not sure what all they do.

pulfalight.title: Use actual component ids (with dots) in urls
Some documents can't be exported to XML

comments.body:
In the most recent case:
 https://findingaids.princeton.edu/catalog/AC198-05_c1791.xml

The document contains "id="AC198.05_c1791" while the id of the page is "id="AC198-05_c1791", so the this line raises an error:
https://github.com/pulibrary/pulfalight/blob/815f2f13e092cd034c7d31311ae50aabe47c02d9/app/models/pulfalight/document/xml_export.rb#L14

The solution is to make the the xpath query more flexible.
